intro: Neonavajoa peeblesiana, commonly known as the Peabody's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Neonavajoa peeblesiana is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its ecological significance in supporting local insect populations.
